topic.title: Resolving Git Merge Conflicts During Upgrade

section.title: Introduction
section.p: When you perform an upgrade, attempts to incorporate new or updated configuation information on top of your existing environment. However, if you have made certain changes to your environment, cannot automatically determine whether to keep your changes or drop them in favour of the new or updated configurations it wants to put in place. This will result in a merge conflict occurring during upgrade and it will be up to you to manually resolve the conflict before the upgrade can procede.

This document gives an overview of how to approach the issue of merge conflicts, showing general procedures for determining where the conflict is occurring, alternative methods for resolution, and a fallback procedure for the case where the resolution goes wrong and you need to start from scratch.

section.title: Identifying the occurrence of a merge conflict
section.p: If you hit a merge conflict during upgrade, you will observe output similar to the following on the console:
section.codeblock: Auto-merging hos/ansible/roles/nova-compute-esx/defaults/main.yml Auto-merging hos/ansible/roles/nova-common/templates/nova.conf.j2 CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in hos/ansible/roles/nova-common/templates/nova.conf.j2 Auto-merging hos/ansible/roles/nova-cli/tasks/availability_zones.yml Auto-merging hos/ansible/roles/nova-api/templates/api-paste.ini.j2
